data.question: What is the main application of compounds containing a trifluoromethylthio group?
data.answer: They are found in many pharmaceutical and agrochemical products.

data.question: Why have aryl trifluoromethylthioethers attracted increasing attention from synthetic chemists?
data.answer: Due to their high lipophilicity and hydrophobicity.

data.question: Is the copper trifluoromethylthiolate (CuSCF3) reagent considered promising for the trifluoromethylthiolation of arenes?

Did the nature of the nitrogen ligands affect the formation of trifluoromethylthiolation products?
Which ligand was found to be the most effective for trifluoromethylthiolation?
What was the effect of solvent on the trifluoromethylthiolation reaction efficiency?
data.answer: CH3CN was identified as the best solvent for the reaction.

data.question: Is CH3CN the best solvent for trifluoromethylthiolation of aryl halides?
What was the yield of the product when the reaction temperature was lowered to 90 8C?
Did heteroaryl iodides and bromides react to afford the products in good yields?
What computational studies suggest about the reaction mechanism for trifluoromethylthiolation?
data.answer: The reaction may proceed through a CuIII intermediate in an OA/RE pathway.
